titleStmt.title: H. S. Burnam to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG14018

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Enrolled Militia Records 1864 - 1865 ; Adair, Allen, Boyle, Daviess, Garrard, Owen, Pendleton, and Shelby counties
msIdentifier.idno: Flat Box 7, Folder 865 GARRARD COUNTY THE GARRARD WIDE AWAKES 1st LT James W. Ross 59 Members 7th Rgt Ky Militia

body.p:
Lancaster Ky Augt 14th/65
To his Excellency
Thos E. Bramlett.

Dr Sir Some of our citizens are inclined to organize a Company of state Malitia for to be Mustered into the service of U. S. with Wm J. Ross_ Late Orderly Sargeant of Company D. G 1st Ky Vo. Cav -- as Captain we therefore Orderlly recommend. Said Ross to your Excellency for a Commission for ^said^ office. Any recommendation that is necessary can be heard for as an efficent officer to an honorable gentleman

Yours
L R McMurtry
H. S. Burnam

Lancaster Ky,
Aug. A 14, 1865.
L. R. McMurtry
H S. Burnam
To Gov.
Recommending Wm J. Ross for a Captain's Com. to recruit a Co. of Active Militia
Ans. Aug 24, 64 Lt. Bk. B. p. 270
Rec I G. O. Aug. 24, 1865
